title: Gamification-Based University Student Civic Traffic Safety Competency Enhancement Program: Strengthening Social Responsibility and Community Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic traffic laws and safety regulations, foundational awareness of community issues, and basic knowledge of citizen rights and responsibilities
context.additional_context: Face-to-face classes with hands-on activities, gamification tools optimized for smartphones, community-linked projects to strengthen civic engagement, and enhanced traffic safety education considering political and cultural contexts.

learning_goals: Through risk scenario simulation games, learners improve safe decision-making and traffic rule application in real-road environments by ≥80% and cultivate civic responsibility.
Using a reward system (points/badges), learners achieve ≥90% familiarity with traffic safety rules and civic awareness, strengthening proactive attitudes toward community problem-solving.

In 3–4 person teams, learners complete 2 team-based missions (e.g., local traffic problem-solving projects) over 2 weeks, submit improvements reflecting ≥3 peer feedbacks, and achieve ≥4.0/5.0 on 4 of 5 team evaluation rubric items (communication, responsibility, creativity, civility, problem-solving).

resources: Traffic Safety Simulation Board Game Kit
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
